text: I have some Julia scripts, but when I run them, Julia does not keep a compiled version in ~/.julia/. On my laptop, I have a directory in ~/src with two .toml files and some Julia source; running Julia on that (which I haven't done in many moons) does result in files in ~/.julia/compiled/. How do I tell Julia to keep compiled versions of scripts in ~/bin or other places that don't have .toml files?

elements.text: I have some Julia scripts, but when I run them, Julia does not keep a compiled version in ~/.julia/. On my laptop, I have a directory in ~/src with two .toml files and some Julia source; running Julia on that (which I haven't done in many moons) does result in files in ~/.julia/compiled/. How do I tell Julia to keep compiled versions of scripts in ~/bin or other places that don't have .toml files?

text: code is cached for environments and their corresponding modules (which your directories with Project.toml presumably contains)

elements.text: code is cached for environments and their corresponding modules (which your directories with Project.toml presumably contains)

text: Is there a way to get it to cache my own code?

elements.text: Is there a way to get it to cache my own code?
